# WebPeel Documentation

WebPeel is an open-source web scraping, data extraction, and research tool. It converts any webpage into clean, AI-ready Markdown with automatic content pruning (15-33% token savings), supports browser rendering for JavaScript-heavy sites, and offers web search, crawling, batch fetching, deep research, and an MCP server with 13 tools for AI assistants.

## Key Features
- Web scraping with smart escalation (HTTP → browser → stealth)
- Content density pruning (automatic chrome removal)
- BM25 query-focused filtering
- Deep research agent (multi-source, synthesized reports)
- Page actions (click, scroll, type, fill, wait)
- JSON Schema extraction (LLM-powered)
- Browser profiles (persistent login sessions)
- 7 CSS schemas for structured extraction
- Proxy support (HTTP/HTTPS/SOCKS5)
- Smart chunking (semantic/fixed/paragraph)

## Getting Started
https://webpeel.dev/docs/getting-started

## CLI Reference
https://webpeel.dev/docs/cli

## API Reference
https://webpeel.dev/docs/api-reference

## MCP Server (13 tools)
https://webpeel.dev/docs/mcp

## Deep Research
https://webpeel.dev/docs/research

## Token Efficiency
https://webpeel.dev/docs/token-efficiency

## SDKs & Integrations
- Node.js: `npm install webpeel`
- Python: `pip install webpeel`
- MCP: stdio or HTTP Streamable transport
- Firecrawl-compatible API at `/v2/scrape`

## Self-Hosting
https://webpeel.dev/docs/self-hosting

## Changelog
https://webpeel.dev/changelog
